fullText: Mr. Hoffman's Willy is a small, pale man who seems to be dissolving before our eyes, consumed by the acid of his own corrosive disappointment. This is a Willy who inspires more pity than anger, and Mr. Hoffman finds the poignancy in Miller's antihero without sentimentalizing him.
